text:
A post shared by Transun Travel (@transuntravel) on Mar 11, 2014 at 5:08am PDT 
Lapland isn’t only home to Father Christmas, it’s also where you can see the spectacular Northern Lights. 
On the trips organised by Transun, you can also experience sledding behind a pack of huskies, snowmobiling at speed over frozen rivers or some ice fishing. 
Various packages, from a few nights to a week, can be arranged in the Swedish Lapland, with prices including flights and the thermal outfits you’ll be needing. Hidden Morocco 
Think Morocco and exotic souks, snake charmers and bartering for rugs might come to mind. 
You can experience all this on a journey to Marrakesh with Water By Nature but it also includes a trip to the Atlas Mountains where your raft awaits. 
Stunning scenery, hidden gorges and exciting rapids can be found along the river Ahansel. 
The night skies around the campfires are out of this world. 
Extras could include quad biking, a hot air balloon trip or a camel ride. Tonga Survivor (Picture: Getty) 
What’s more adventurous than choosing to get stranded on a deserted island with no shelter, water or equipment to catch your dinner? 
On this Tonga Survivor Island Expedition, you’ll have to work with your fellow travellers to figure out how to survive. 
It’s like a disaster movie or The Island, only without the cameras (which might be a blessing when it turns out you’re less like Bear Grylls than you thought).
